page.title: 02THE OLD WATER MILL.
page.content: This has always been a farming area and it is mentioned in the Domesday Book under the Soke of Wachenfeld. There are several old farmhouses and at Mr. Swift's farm there is an old water mill which is a listed building. During the war the old water wheel was ripped off for scrap metal but other_ wise it would have been the second largest in the British Isles. It took eight horses to start it, and once they got mangled in the machinery. When the mill was working, the water to keep the wheel going ran from the pond down a pipe, out into the stream. The stream drove the wheel. The pond is very pretty, with trees and grassy banks around it. The pond's wildlife is quite large. There are coots, mallards, geese, trout, bream and tadpoles.
